title: Fans' favourite Toni Duggan back to take on Manchester City
text:
Toni Duggan returns to Manchester City on Wednesday night for the first time since leaving the club when Atletico Madrid arrive for a Champions League last-16 first-leg tie.

The England international left in 2017 for Barcelona and transferred to Atletico at the start of this season.

“She was a fans’ favourite here and we hope she gets a big welcome,” said Manchester City manager Nick Cushing. “If you look at Toni’s history here she scored some incredibly big goals, she played well and she won trophies, too.”

Duggan will hope her team can repeat their performance last season when they knocked City out of the Champions League in the last 32.

City, who beat Swiss side Lugano 11-1 on aggregate in the last 32, did beat Altetico 3-2 when they played in August. They have had an impressive start to the season, scoring 23 goals in seven consecutive wins, and conceding only one goal, even with Ellen White still out injured.
description: Toni Duggan returns to Manchester City on Wednesday night for the first time since leaving the club when Atletico Madrid arrive for a Champions League last-16 first-leg tie.
